words.definition: To treat someone in a dishonest way.
words.example: The man betrayed his country.

words.definition: A loud noise made by an explosion.
words.example: There was a loud blast when the bomb went off.

words.definition: Jewelry worn around your wrist.
words.example: He gave her a gold bracelet.

words.definition: To stop.
words.example: After an hour, the rain ceased.

words.definition: To be unable to breathe.
words.example: He choked on a piece of bread.

words.definition: Related to the people of a country.
words.example: The country was in a state of civil war.

words.definition: To say something about something.
words.example: He commented on her new dress.

words.definition: When someone is angry.
words.example: The teacher was cross with the students.

words.definition: A small area pushed in on a hard surface.
words.example: There was a dent in the car door.

words.definition: To not trust someone.
words.example: I distrust anyone who lies to me.

words.definition: A strong building used for defense.
words.example: The soldiers built a fort to protect the city.

words.definition: To start something.
words.example: The company was founded in 1950.

words.definition: Cloth that covers the inside of something.
words.example: The jacket has a warm lining.

words.definition: A large amount of something.
words.example: There was a mass of people at the concert.

words.definition: To speak to God.
words.example: She prays every morning.

words.definition: When something is very common.
words.example: The city was rife with crime.

words.definition: When something is the only one.
words.example: He was the sole survivor of the crash.

words.definition: To clean the floor with a broom.
words.example: I swept the kitchen floor.

words.definition: Being dishonest to someone who trusts you.
words.example: The king was shocked by the treachery of his advisor.

words.definition: To put it into a small space.
words.example: He tucked the letter into his pocket.
